Database Name: ACS National Surgical Quality Improvement Program (ACS NSQIP)
Database Description: A nationally validated, risk-adjusted, outcomes-based program to measure and improve the quality of surgical care in the private sector.
Compiles data over 100 emergency departments around the country who voluntarily report their best practices and performance indicators.

Database Name: Family Evaluation of Hospice Care Survey
Database Description: A post-death survey designed to yield actionable information that reflects the quality of hospice care delivery from the perspective of family caregivers.

Database Name: Long Term Care Minimum Data Set (MDS)
Database Description: Part of the federally mandated process for clinical assessment of all residents in Medicare or Medicaid certified nursing homes.
Includes clinical outcomes, processes of care, care management efficiency, resource utilization, coding compliance, and patient safety.

Personnel collect data on central line-associated primary bloodstream infections (BSIs), ventilator-associated pneumonias, or urinary catheter associated urinary tract infections (UTIs) that occur in patients staying in a patient care locations.
Performance measurement and improvement initiative, which integrates outcomes and other performance measure data into the accreditation process.

Compares top-box patient survey scores –the percentage of excellent responses on most patient survey forms – with the corresponding SullivanLuallinGroup survey questions. The application also includes comparisons with AHRQ CG-CAHPS.
A national source of comparable performance results from HEDIS and CAHPS for the comparison of health plans.
Measurement, feedback and improvement tools for hematology-oncology practices.
Premier houses the nation’s largest clinical, financial and outcomes database.
The database contains a core set of information appropriate for reviewing the operation and performance of health centers.
